newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy govt could intervene in metalworkers row.
newsitem.headline: Italy govt could intervene in metalworkers row.

text.p: Prime Minister Romano Prodi said on Friday that the Italian government would intervene directly in a pay dispute between metal and engineering workers and employers if such action was useful.

Labour Minister Tiziano Treu has been holding separate talks with trades unions and the employers organisation Federmeccanica but is not formally mediating in the dispute, which has been accompanied by strikes.
Prodi told an end of years news conference that the dispute, over salary levels in labour contracts up for renewal, had reached a "very delicate" phase.
He said the government would intervene directly when such action "could be useful in unblocking a situation that has become bogged down".

Trades unions and Federmeccanica are at odds over how much money should be included in new contracts for loss of purchasing power during the past two-year contractual agreement, which expired in June.
